meaningMnemonic: If you <radical>stand</radical> in front of a <radical>tsunami</radical>, you’re going to <kanji>cry</kanji>. That tsunami is going to hit you hard, and rip you right off the ground on which you stand. Who wouldn't cry?
readingMnemonic: Do you know the only way to stop yourself <kanji>cry</kanji>ing after a tsunami? That's right, <reading>na</reading>chos (な)! Nachos are the only proven way to cheer people up after being hit by a tsunami.
